com.ibm.icu.util
Class TimeZoneRule

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.icu.util.TimeZoneRule
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnnualTimeZoneRule, TimeArrayTimeZoneRule
public class TimeZoneRule
extends java.lang.Object

TimeZoneRule is a class representing a rule for time zone. An instance of TimeZoneRule has a set of time zone attributes, such as zone name, GMT offset and daylight saving time offset. The subclasses may provide methods to get actual time when the time zone defined by the rule takes effect. Typically, a practical time zone can be defined by a set of TimeZoneRule instances.

Constructor Summary

          Constructs a TimeZoneRule with the name, the GMT offset of its standard time and the amount of daylight saving offset adjustment.

Constructor Detail

TimeZoneRule

public TimeZoneRule(java.lang.String name,
                    int stdOffset,
                    int dstSaving)
Constructs a TimeZoneRule with the name, the GMT offset of its standard time and the amount of daylight saving offset adjustment.

Parameters:
name - The time zone name.
stdOffset - The GMT offset of its standard time in milliseconds.
dstSaving - The amount of daylight saving offset adjustment in milliseconds. If this ia a rule for standard time, the value of this argument is 0.

public int getStdOffset()
Gets the standard time offset.

Returns:
The standard time offset from UTC in milliseconds.

getDstSaving

public int getDstSaving()
Gets the amount of daylight saving delta time from the standard time.

Returns:
The amount of daylight saving offset used by this rule in milliseconds.
